title: Reviewing Valence Electrons
text: Start by counting the total number of valence electrons each atom contributes. Remember that carbon has 4 valence electrons, oxygen has 6, and hydrogen has 1. Add them up and compare to the number shown in the Lewis structure.

title: Checking the Octet Rule
text: Look at each carbon atom in the structure. Count the total number of electrons around each carbon, including bonds and lone pairs. Does each carbon have 8 electrons, satisfying the octet rule?

title: Considering Oxygen's Lone Pairs
text: Recall that oxygen typically has two lone pairs when it forms two bonds. Examine the structure to see if this is the case, or if there are more or fewer lone pairs than expected.

title: Evaluating Overall Correctness
text: After checking the valence electrons, octet rule, and lone pairs, decide whether any of these issues make the Lewis structure incorrect or if it is actually valid.
